Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Shay Mavis, at 269-243-2725.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation
A youth had their ankle fractured and is in a boot as a result of a
restraint.
Additional Allegation
Youth A alleged during her 04/21/2025 interview that her right
elbow was sprained during a restraint.
Investigation Allegation
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 04/18/2025 by phone.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/21/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Youth A stated Former Staff redirected her to get off the
bathroom floor on Orange Wing and then stepped on her ankle.
Youth A stated she got up from the ground and punched Former
Staff. Youth A stated she sat down in the hallway and Former
Staff stepped on her ankle again. Youth A stated there were no
youth or staff witnesses to this incident. Youth A stated she does
not recall when this incident occurred but her ankle was evaluated
and she was prescribed a boot to wear. Youth A was observed on
04/21/2025 wearing a boot on her right ankle.
Former Staff was interviewed on 05/05/2025 by phone. Former
Staff stated he does not recall Youth A and denied stepping on
any youths’ ankles.
Documentation
Youth A’s health care records state she was seen at an orthopedic
clinic on 04/03/2025 for back and knee pain follow up. Youth A
was also seen for a right ankle sprain at this appointment. Youth
A’s visit summary states Youth A reported running, falling down
2

and inverting her right ankle as she got up about a week ago and
being ambulatory with pain since the fall. It states Youth A’s right
ankle x-ray does not show fracture or dislocation. Youth A was
prescribed a CAM boot. Youth A’s follow up appointment
scheduled for 04/24/2025 was rescheduled due to her truancy on
04/24/2025. Youth is rescheduled for follow up on 05/05/2025.
Youth A does not have an incident report about injuring her ankle
or an incident report involving Former Staff from 03/17/2025 to
04/03/2025 (time period before her orthopedic follow up
appointment) per Vista Representative.
Additional Allegation
Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/21/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Youth A stated she was upset because she was not allowed
to attend Dreams, an on-campus activity, due to her behavior.
Youth A stated she had contraband (does not recall what it was) in
her room and a male staff (does not recall who) and a female staff
(does not recall who) entered her room to retrieve it. Youth A
stated the male staff tightly held her arm and sprained it. Youth A
stated the incident occurred inside the fourth room on Purple Wing
on an unknown date. Youth A stated Supervisor and Manager
may have witnessed the incident.
Manager was interviewed on 05/22/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Manager stated Youth A was upset because she could not
attend Dreams, which is an independent living skills activity
facilitated by outside speakers. Manager stated she responded to
an assistance call and saw Youth A throwing things in her room.
Manager stated Youth A did not comply with verbal redirection,
broke a plastic cup and threatened to self-harm by
scratching/cutting her wrist with a piece of a plastic cup. Manager
stated two staff (does not recall who) secured Youth A in a
standing two person hold and Manager took the piece of plastic
cup piece out of Youth A’s hand. Manager stated emergency
medical services arrived and Youth A settled down. Manager
stated Youth A’s physical management hold was appropriate and
does not recall Youth A stating her elbow was injured.
Supervisor was interviewed on 05/05/2025 at Vista Maria –
Deroy Hall. Supervisor stated he does not recall Youth A’s elbow
being injured during a physical management incident. Supervisor
stated Youth A would have been assessed onsite or offsite if she
complained of elbow pain.
3

Attempts to interview Former Staff 2 and Former Staff 3 (who
were identified in the incident report) were made on 05/15/2025
and 05/23/2025 but they were unsuccessful.
Supervisor 2 was not interviewed on 05/15/2025 due to being on
personal leave. Attempt was made to interview Supervisor 2 on
05/23/2025 by phone, but it was unsuccessful.
Documentation
Supervisor 2 wrote an incident report dated 02/05/2025 at 5:40
PM. It states Youth A threatened self-harm and started to scratch
her wrist with a plastic piece when she learned she was not
attending the Dreams program. Supervisor 2 and Former Staff 2
entered Youth A’s room to retrieve the plastic piece from Youth A.
Youth A threatened them and threw a plastic cup on the ground.
Supervisor 2, Former Staff 2 and Youth A picked up the broken
plastic cup pieces off the ground and cleared Youth A’s room of
belongings. Youth A charged forward and Supervisor 2 and
Former Staff 2 physically managed Youth A. After Youth A was
released, she sat down and pulled a plastic piece from her bra
and tried to cut her wrist. Supervisor 2 and Former Staff 3 secured
Youth A and Manager retrieved the plastic piece from Youth A.
Emergency personnel and law enforcement arrived around 6:15
PM. Youth A told them that Supervisor 2 stabbed her hand and
twisted her arm while holding a piece of plastic and threatening
self-harm. Youth A was transported to a local hospital for
evaluation.
Youth A’s health care records state she was seen offsite on
02/05/2025. Youth A received two x-rays of her right elbow. Youth
A was diagnosed with an elbow sprain and prescribed a sling.
Supervisor 2 completed Crisis Prevention Institute – Nonviolent
Crisis Physical Intervention on 02/20/2025. Supervisor 2 has a
discipline history of using profanity towards staff, workplace
boundary with staff, medication error, and following leadership
expectations.
Former Staff 2 completed Crisis Prevention Institute - Nonviolent
Crisis Physical Intervention on 02/13/2025. Former Staff 2 had a
discipline history of insubordination, medication error and driving
over the speed limit.
Former Staff 3 completed Crisis Prevention Institute – Nonviolent
Crisis Physical Intervention on 12/17/2024. Former Staff 3 did not
have a discipline history.
4

Vista Maria’s Behavior Management 005-010 policy and
procedure states “To maintain a safe environment for all Vista
Maria clients and staff, behavior management interventions are
only used when a client presents a danger to self or others.”
Analysis Allegation
The agency is found in compliance as there is no evidence
supporting Former Staff stepped on Youth A’s ankle and caused
injury to her right ankle.
Additional Finding
The agency is found in compliance as there is not enough
information to make a conclusive determination without the
interviews of Supervisor 2, who is on personal leave, Former Staff
2 and Former Staff 3. Although Youth A reports being injured
because of the restraint, Manager reports the restraint was done
appropriately. Video documentation is also lacking because the
incident occurred inside Youth A’s room, which is not under video
camera surveillance.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
Description (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Youth A alleged during her 04/21/2025 interview that Staff 1 told
her to “Shut the fuck up”.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/21/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Youth A stated Staff 1 redirected Youth A and Youth B to
change out of their leggings because their leggings were too tight.
Youth A stated she and Youth B refused. Youth A stated she told
Staff 1 to stop talking and Staff 1 said, “Shut the fuck up”. Youth A
stated she did not recall the date of this incident but Staff 1 was
moved to another wing for the remainder of the shift. Youth A
stated Youth B was the only witness to this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/05/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Youth B stated Staff 1 redirected Youth A and Youth B to
change out of their tight leggings. Youth B stated she told Staff 1
that she wore the leggings at school and all day without issue.
Youth B stated Staff 1 said, “Shut the fuck up” and the incident
5

ended without Youth A or Youth B changing their leggings. Youth
B did not recall the date of this incident. Youth B stated Youth A
was the only witness to this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/06/2025 by phone. Staff 1 stated
she recalled the incident about Youth A and Youth B wearing tight
leggings without a skirt or long shirt covering their buttocks. Staff 1
stated she redirected Youth A and Youth B to change and Youth A
said, “You don’t know the rules”. Staff 1 stated Youth A raised her
middle finger and threatened to hit and pour water on Staff 1. Staff
1 stated she does not know if Youth A and Youth B changed their
leggings because she was reassigned to another wing due to
staffing needs. Staff 1 denied telling Youth A or Youth B to “shut
up” or using profanity in this incident.
Manager was interviewed on 05/22/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Manager stated she has never heard Staff 1 use profanity.
Manager is unaware of an incident between Staff 1, Youth A and
Youth B over tight leggings. Manager stated Staff 1 is not favored
by the youths because she holds them accountable.
Documentation
03/22/2025 incident report written by Staff 1 states incident
occurred at 7:00 PM. Incident report correlates with Staff 1’s
interview.
Vista Maria’s Employee Behavior 022-114 policy and procedure
prohibits staff from using profanity or abusive language.
Staff 1 has a discipline history of using her cell phone on the job.
Staff 1 signed the behavior management policy on 12/9/24.
Analysis The agency is found in violation because Youth A and Youth B
stated Staff 1 said “shut the fuck up” to Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2025SIC0000556 dated 5/30/25; CAP pending
SIR #2024SIC0001371 dated 5/17/24; CAP approved 10/21/24
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical and dental and behavioral
health care.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
6

Allegation Youth A alleged during her 04/21/2025 interview that she did not
receive immediate medical treatment for her sprained right pinky
finger, which forced her to place a bead in her ear to go to an
urgent care for treatment.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/21/2025 at Vista Maria – Deroy
Hall. Youth A stated Team Lead grabbed her right hand to get a
piece of glass out of her hand and this action sprained Youth A’s
right pinky. Youth A was asked to describe the glass piece and
explain how she obtained it. Youth A said, “It’s glass. Glass is
everywhere”. Youth A stated no one believed her right pinky was
sprained, so she placed a plastic bead in her ear to go to urgent
care for treatment of her pinky. Youth A stated the urgent care
staff removed the bead from her ear and gave her a splint for her
right pinky finger. Youth A was observed without a splint on her
right pinky finger during her interview. Youth A stated she lost the
splint. Youth A’s right pinky finger was observed without swelling
or discoloration and she was able to open and close her hand
without hesitancy. Youth A stated this incident occurred in Green
Wing’s common area and she did not know the date of the
incident. Youth A stated there are no witnesses to Team Lead
taking the glass out of her hand.
Team Lead was interviewed on 05/23/2025 by phone. Team Lead
stated she is assigned to Vista Maria – Beata Hall and on
occasion works at Vista Maria – Deroy Hall. Team Lead stated
she never took a glass piece or an object out of Youth A’s hand.
Team Lead stated she would have written an incident report if this
occurred.
Vista Representative was interviewed on 04/25/2025 at Vista
Maria – Deroy. Vista Representative stated he has frequent
contact with youths including Youth A. Vista Representative stated
he never witnessed Youth A wear a splint on any finger.
Documentation
Youth A’s health care records state she was seen offsite on
02/22/2025 and 03/08/2025 at urgent cares for placing a bead in
her ear. These records do not document Youth A was also seen
and provided a splint for a sprained right pinky finger.
Youth A does not have an incident report about having a piece of
glass taken out of her hand in 02/2025 or 03/2025 per Vista
Representative.
7

Team Lead completed Crisis Prevention Institute - Nonviolent
Crisis Physical Intervention on 07/25/2024 and Standard First Aid
training on 09/03/2024. Team Lead does not have a discipline
history.
Vista Maria’s Emergency Medical Care WI-0053-004 policy and
procedure states for non-life-threatening situations the shift
supervisor arranges a youth’s offsite emergency care based on
the direction of the nurse or on-call program manager.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with providing Youth A’s health
care needs. Youth A was treated twice for placing a bead in her
ear. There is no documentation supporting Youth A’s right pinky is
sprained or a staff injured her pinky while taking glass out of her
hand.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the
current license status be continued.
